abstract: Central bankers and economists at a gathering in Europe said the financial contagion of the last decade could have been avoided.
snippet: Central bankers and economists at a gathering in Europe said the financial contagion of the last decade could have been avoided.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — Jamie Dimon, chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, famously said at Davos in January that he was tired of everybody always picking on banks. Good thing he wasn’t at the going-away event for Gertrude Tumpel-Gugerell, outgoing member of the executive board of the European Central Bank.
